params._recoveryHash: Hash of the recovery request to be canceled.

constructor.details: Initializes the contract with the owner and guardian addresses.

params._adminManager: Address of the adminManager contract of the escrow platform.

executeRecovery(uint8,address,address).details: This function checks that the recovery period has elapsed and that the recovery is confirmed before executing it.

params._accountType: Type of the account being recovered, either CLIENT or CONTRACTOR.
params._escrow: Address of the escrow involved in the recovery.
params._oldAccount: Old account address being replaced in the recovery.

getRecoveryHash(address,address,address).details: Generates the recovery hash that should be signed by the guardian to initiate a recovery.

params._oldAccount: Address of the user being replaced.

params._escrow: Address of the escrow contract related to the recovery.
params._escrowType: Type of the escrow contract involved.
params._newAccount: New account address to replace the old one.
params._oldAccount: Current account address that needs recovery.

updateAdminManager(address).details: Restricts the function to be callable only by the current owner of the admin manager.

params._adminManager: The new address of the admin manager contract.

updateRecoveryPeriod(uint256).details: Can only be called by the owner of the contract.

params._recoveryPeriod: The new recovery period in seconds.

initiateRecovery(address,uint256,uint256.notice: Initiates the recovery process for an account.

updateAdminManager(address).notice: Updates the address of the admin manager contract.

updateRecoveryPeriod(uint256).notice: Updates the recovery period to a new value, ensuring it meets minimum requirements.

@dev Recovery period after which recovery can be executed.
@dev Configurable recovery period initialized to the minimum allowed.
@notice Data structure to store recovery-related information.
@dev Mapping of recovery hashes to their corresponding data.
@dev Thrown when zero address usage where prohibited.
@dev Thrown when trying to execute an already executed recovery.
@dev Thrown when trying to execute recovery before the period has elapsed.
@dev Thrown when trying to execute a recovery that has not been confirmed.
@dev Thrown when an unauthorized account attempts a restricted action.
@dev Thrown indicates an attempt to set the recovery period below the minimum required or to zero.
@dev Emitted when a recovery is initiated by the guardian.
@dev Emitted when a recovery is executed successfully.
@dev Emitted when a recovery is canceled.
@dev Emitted when the recovery period is updated to a new value.
@dev Emitted when the admin manager address is updated in the contract.
